articles.author: Anastasiia Malenko, Max Hunder
articles.description: Russian assaults are raising pressure on the strategic eastern logistics hub of Pokrovsk, Ukraine said on Friday, as waves of guided bombs and infantry lead to some of Moscow's largest territorial gains since the spring.
articles.title: Russian troops inch forward in Ukraine's east with waves of bombs and infantry

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A major Venezuelan opposition movement on Friday said its headquarters had been vandalized amid ongoing tensions over a disputed presidential election, as the country's foreign minister said the U.S. was at the forefront of what the government calls a coup attempt.
articles.title: Venezuelan opposition says headquarters invaded as government alleges coup attempt

articles.author: Nandita Bose, Trevor Hunnicutt, Jeff Mason
articles.description: Kamala Harris is preparing for the fight of her life, if her inner circle is anything to go by.The vice president has surrounded herself with a group of tested operators, many of them Black women who have been involved in Democratic politics for decades.
articles.title: Kamala Harris' inner circle girds for battle

articles.author: Tala Ramadan, Jana Choukeir
articles.description: Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh will be buried in Qatar on Friday following his assassination in the Iranian capital Tehran, one in a series of killings of senior figures in the Palestinian militant group as the war between Israel and Hamas in Gaza rages.
articles.title: Funeral for slain Hamas leader Haniyeh to be held in Qatar

articles.author: Andrea Shalal, Kanishka Singh
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden said on Thursday the killing of Palestinian Islamist group Hamas' leader Ismail Haniyeh was not helpful for reaching a ceasefire in Israel's war in Gaza.
articles.title: Biden says killing of Hamas leader Haniyeh not helpful for ceasefire talks

articles.author: Mircely Guanipa
articles.description: Relatives of people arrested during protests in Venezuela over the country's contested presidential election are calling for their release outside police headquarters as political tensions in the South American country remain high.
articles.title: Venezuelans call for release of relatives arrested in election protests

articles.author: Andrew Osborn, Filipp Lebedev, Lucy Papachristou
articles.description: Jailed U.S. Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich and ex-U.S. Marine Paul Whelan were among 26 prisoners from the United States, Russia, Germany, Poland, Slovenia, Norway and Belarus being freed in a major east-west exchange on Thursday, Turkey's presidency said.
articles.title: Americans Gershkovich and Whelan included in big Russia-West prisoner swap

articles.author: Thomas Escritt
articles.description: Belarus rights activists pressed Germany for answers on Friday as to why Belarusian political prisoners, including a prominent and popular opposition leader, had not been included in the biggest prisoner swap since the Cold War on Thursday.
articles.title: Belarus rights activists ask why their prisoners were left out of swap

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin has informed Israel about current and future changes to U.S. forces in the Middle East, the Pentagon said on Wednesday, though he had not decided which additional capabilities to send.
articles.title: Pentagon tells Israel it will adjust US troops in Middle East

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw
articles.description: The Democratic National Committee's newest advertising campaign, launched on Friday, taunt Republican rival Donald Trump for not committing to a debate with Kamala Harris and is set to follow him on the campaign trail.
articles.title: New ads calling Trump 'afraid to debate' to follow him on campaign trail
